What to Know About the Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School Application Form Portal

The Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School ILSN Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission list, etc.

Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School

Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School is a private nursing school located in the province of Gauteng in South Africa. The school offers various nursing programs, including a one-year Enrolled Nursing Auxiliary (ENA) course, a two-year Enrolled Nursing course, and a four-year Bachelor of Nursing Science (B Cur) degree.

The school’s mission is to provide quality nursing education and training that meets the needs of the healthcare industry in South Africa. It aims to produce competent, caring, and ethical nurses who are equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to provide excellent patient care.

key facts about Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School

Here are some key facts about Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School:

Location:

Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School is located in Germiston, Gauteng, South Africa.

Programs Offered:

The school offers a range of nursing programs, including a one-year Enrolled Nursing Auxiliary (ENA) course, a two-year Enrolled Nursing course, and a four-year Bachelor of Nursing Science (B Cur) degree.

Accreditation:

The school is accredited by the South African Nursing Council (SANC), which means that its nursing programs meet the standards set by the council.

Admission Requirements:

To be admitted to any of the nursing programs offered by the school, applicants must have a matric certificate or equivalent qualification and meet the other specific requirements for the program they are applying for.

Teaching Methodology:

The school uses a combination of classroom lectures, practical training, and clinical placements to ensure that students gain the necessary knowledge and skills to become competent nurses.

Facilities:

The school has modern facilities, including well-equipped classrooms, a nursing laboratory, and a simulation ward, which allows students to practice their nursing skills in a safe and controlled environment.

Career Opportunities:

Graduates of Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School have access to a range of career opportunities in the nursing profession, including working in hospitals, clinics, and other healthcare settings.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the ILSN application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to ILSN on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%
Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School application steps
Here are the general steps for applying to Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School:

Choose a program: Determine which nursing program you want to apply for and make sure you meet the admission requirements for that program.

Obtain an application form: You can obtain an application form from the school’s website or by contacting the admissions office directly.

Complete the application form: Fill out the application form accurately and completely. Be sure to attach all the required documents and pay the application fee if applicable.

Submit the application: Submit you are completed application form and supporting documents to the school’s admissions office by the specified deadline.

Wait for a response: Wait for the school to process your application. You may be invited for an interview or additional assessments if required.

Acceptance: If your application is successful, you will receive an acceptance letter from the school. You will then need to confirm your acceptance by paying a registration fee and any other required fees.

Attend Orientation: Attend the orientation program and familiarize yourself with the school’s policies, procedures, and expectations.

How to Apply | ILSN Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit Application portal: http://www.ikusasalethunursingschool.co.za/
  • Choose the type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

 

Ikusasa Lethu Nursing School Application Required Documents

To apply to ILSN you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript
